course_title: Special Topics in Religion: Kierkegaard, Dostoyevsky & Job

class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Theme.
The classical formulation of the question of theodicy, the theological explanation of suffering, and its discrediting, is found in the biblical Book of Job. This seminar focuses on the readings of Job by nineteenth century "existentialist" writers, Soren Kierkegaard and Fyodor Dostoevsky. In Repetition, Kierkegaard's protagonist uses the example of Job's ordeal and legendary patience as an intensely personal lens through which to view his broken engagement. In Dostoevsky's The Brothers Karamazov, Ivan Karamazov's denunciation of God's world is modeled on the impatient, rebel Job, while the holy elder Zossima bases his life-philosophy on Job the patient.
